alert.note: Alert for Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 21 at 1:25PM PDT until October 23 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM SATURDAY TO MIDNIGHT MST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Western portion of Joshua Tree National Park. * WHEN...From 2 PM Saturday to midnight MST Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
